Reviews.Title: mixed feelings ....
Reviews.Author: Paul Kwan "paul the reviewer"
Reviews.Content: It seems to me that this camera requires some learning ...theauto and other shooting options seem to be either over exposedor under exposed. I always need to adjust the exposure to get abetter image quality.If you are looking for a pure point and shoot with no moreintervention, this camera may not be right for you and youmay find the image quality is not good at all.However, the new feature such as panorama mode is easy to use.The twilight and anti-burr options are nice but also requiremanual adjustment of exposure.The HD video recording result is also very good.Again, if you are willing to spend some time to learn to usethis point and shoot, this is the right camera for you. if not,please look for another model.Good luck !!

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: V. Halsey "LuvGoddes"
Reviews.Content: I'm very pleased with my purchase. Great quality images. Great price, Very easy to use. A little bulky but it does fit well in hand.  I absolutely love the panoramic setting when taking "nature" shots.  I love the zoom, my kids don't look like ants on the field during their marching band competitions anymore. All in all a great product for the price.  I recommend it to anyone who's a beginner, looking to get great quality images and video, with ease of use at a great price!

Reviews.Title: Sony DSC-HX1 Camera - - I'm a typical point and shoot user!
Reviews.Author: Lisa Hauk-Scarlett
Reviews.Content: I have used my Kodak V610 for the past three years. I have a 9 year old who is a cheerleader, gymnast, and is very active in school. With all of these things starting back up - I went to get the Kodak ready and was unable to charge it (tried new charger and new battery).Went to Best Buy Saturday night (8/7/10) to look for a new camera (and being frequent BB shoppers we asked one of our "friends" there who would be the best person to speak with - he said Dan). I went to Dan and he asked what I would need this for - I told him I wanted a camera to do the things that my other one didn't - - I wanted a camera that would go from ACTION shots then to a Gym or Auditorium without having to adjust ANYTHING and still have great pics!! He asked if I wanted chargeable batteries or AA - - i said chargeable. He took me right to Sony's DSC-HX1.Well - while it was more than I wanted to pay - I had to have it!! After Dan showed me what I could do with this camera - I was sold!! Everything from action, to being in dark rooms, zoom, panaromic shots, to cropping/editing the pics in camera, and more!! I played with the camera all night (so did my husband who balked at the price - but actually played with it MORE than me). Of course our 9 year old was more than thrilled to pose - haha.But like I said - I am no professional - I am an everyday average mom who needed a camera to do what she wanted it to do with no hassle!! This camera is that camera!! Dan at Best Buy even offered a class if you needed lessons on working the camera - but it's so simple - I think I can wait right now. Haven't tested video yet - but plan on it tonight at cheer practice!!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: GaArmyWife06
Reviews.Content: I love my camera. From now on, I'm sticking to Sony for digital cameras. One of the best features is that panoramic mode. I think the only drawback I've personally found on the camera is that unless I actually set the camera to shoot in burst mode, I can pretty much forget about taking pictures back to back to back. I mean, if there's a way to do that without setting it in burst mode, I don't know about it yet. I'm still discovering new things that I can do with it, so, maybe it's just a matter of time. My pictures are coming out so crisp & clear, that it's just amazing. I couldn't have picked a better camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Wayne L. Snoey
Reviews.Content: This camera is extremely useful.  I didn't want to carry a bunch of extra lenses nor did I want a huge attached zooms lens as is standard with removable lenses.  This camera can do it all.  The sweep mode allows great panorama shots that are automatically stitched together in the camera.  There are many modes to shoot in and I am still learning them.  The twilight mode works quite well in low light and produces some interesting photos.  I have had some unexplained shutdowns, but haven't had time to read the whole manual yet to figure out what is going on.  It may be operator error.

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Amanda Newnam
Reviews.Content: At first I was having doubts about buying this camera because it costs more than other digital camera but I am so happy with what I got.  The camera is VERY easy to use, I love all the features it comes with, especially the sweep (panoramic) mode. SO COOL!  It's very light, not as heavy as it may look.  My only issue is with the battery that came with it.  It's only been lasting for 30 minutes or so, then it says it's dead, and this is even after charging it for over 24 hours.  However, could just have been a bad battery and I haven't seen any other reviews on issues with the battery length.  I'm hoping buying another battery will do the trick.I would DEFINITELY recommend this camera to anyone! Takes amazing pictures!

Reviews.Title: Almost perfect
Reviews.Author: Alexia Lage
Reviews.Content: Very good,I change my DSC H50 for this one.This one improve sequential shots. Now you have much more frames in one second (10 fps)AND this shots are 9 megapixel in hi resolution . I do animals pictures, and this is very usefull to me. If you will use for children, action and animals, is a VERY GREAT improvement. They improve the optical zoom, too. The zoom is great, but Nikon has a larger one. The colors of the Sony is very near to true colors. If you compare to others like Nikon and Fuji, Sony is very better. The other ones, have colorless pictures that you need to use some software to enrich it. It make 1080p HD video with stereo sound, I Don't know about panoramas... Never tried it!This one don't have infrared nigthshot, but it was useless for me.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Tina from Brooklyn "Piedmont photobug"
Reviews.Content: This is my third Sony DSC H camera.  I have loved everyone of them.Great images, easy to use, lightweight to carry.Love the extra zoom on the HX1 and rapid fps.The panarama reature is not as great as hyped; can't print them with my photomate so still figuring out how to get them printed.Only negative: emailed sony customer service and no reply back.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera!
Reviews.Author: A. Whang
Reviews.Content: The camera takes crispy, vivid pictures. Most features, such as 10 fps burst, work as nicely. The panoramic mode works but not every single shoot succeeds - some of mine were not stitched smoothly, one people's face was 1/4 chopped.The video side is a bit disappointed. When shooting on 1440x1080 HD mode, the unmoved objects are unspeakable clear, but for the moving scenes, such as shooting city building from a moving car, or even just zooming in and zooming out, the video is very unsmooth. I think it drops frames for some reason. But I figure I should use video cam for video and camera for photos only. I own a Sony SR-11 HD camcorder, the video is much smoother - it can take pictures, but just not as good as a camera with the same pixel numbers.Overall, the camera is well worthy for the price. Strongly recommand HX-1.Also, the original camera I received had defect - it could not read any memory sticks. I requested item exchange and the 2nd one was shipped to in front of my house within 20 hrs! Amazing Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great Bridge Camera
Reviews.Author: Uma S "Stan Sthanunathan"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera a week ago and have been playing with it since then.  Produces great photos. Menu is very simple and easy to follow.  Features are awesome too. I would definitely recommend this product.  It produces great photos without having to carry a set of lenses, change them etc.  If you are not a professional photographer but want to take good pictures... this is it. It does not get any better.  One does not associate Sony with still cameras but this one surprised me...pleasantly so. Really delighted with the purchase. Highly recommend this one.  I would use the video recording feature only in case of emergency..my preference is to use Sony HD Video Camera, which produces fabulous videos.

Reviews.Title: best of the bests
Reviews.Author: Emirhan Oznalbant
Reviews.Content: I think this camera is the best in its class.Before this I had dsc-h9 which has excellent image quality.Almost a year I've been using A350 DSLR (with tamron70-300 lens). if you got bored carrying heavy dslr bags with heavy lenses, this is for you.Very sexy black construction. it is not heavy. Battery is ok. Perfect for travelling. In low light conditions you don't even need a tripod. Just hold it close to your body and use tilt function of lcd. I wish hx1 had carlzeiss optic and remote control.

Reviews.Title: Great camera and camcorder all in one piece
Reviews.Author: Rene Gomez Genao
Reviews.Content: This is the best and affordable camera and camcorder you can get in the same package. The image quality is great in its class and the video is unbeatable (1080P). It has several features; some that are inclusively unique, like the panoramic, twilight and anti blur features. It can detect eye blinks, smiles on adults, childs, even on infants, and prioritize between them.It has an incredible zoom (20x), movable 3 inch LCD, and an electronic View Finder with all the functions that are present on the LCD.ConsSo far, the only negative thing that I have found is that with low light when you make a high zoom the focus keeps hunting. I have attended this weakness during the zoom in low light, by selecting manual focus and manually focusing on the desired item.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: McBean "BJMcBean"
Reviews.Content: As the owner of a couple of Nikon digital SLRs (D70 and D300), I was looking for something smaller that I could carry with me every day. When traveling with the Nikons, I always feel compelled to bring all my lenses, filters, lighting, etc., and it quickly becomes a chore.This little camera takes great shots and doesn't need any accessories. The biggest bonus for me is the panorama feature. I've used this in my job to scout locations as well as during a recent trip to Boston.It's simple to use, fool-proof, and the functionality is easy to manage.I'm not the biggest fan of the Sony Memory Stick -- it's just another kind of media card to add to the collection and another card reader to buy.I really do carry this camera with me every day. I have an even smaller camera that just doesn't take shots as great as this Sony.Of course, for my really big sight-seeing trips, I'll lug the Nikons and all their paraphernalia, but for smaller trips and every day use, this Sony is the one and only.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: happy
Reviews.Content: This camera is fantastic!!!!!!  I'm not a big photography buff, or at least I wasn't.  I mainly use it for family pics and its great, it gives me perfect still shots of my running, jumping, swinging daughter.  I have taken it for a spin with some nature photos and they have turned out beautifully.  I understand that many actual photographers may have some issues with some of the features, but for someone who just wants to take pictures of the family or family outings it is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: Sony DSC-HX1 - The Best Super Zoom Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: G. MCDOUGALL
Reviews.Content: I've owned every Sony Super Zoom Digital Camera since introduction of the DSC-H1 and the DSC-HX1 is the BEST yet.  Compared to other cameras, similar to the Sony DSC-HX1, the HX1 is easier to use, has the best features, and takes the best pictures.  I purchased Canon cameras for years but since purchasing Sony cameras, I haven't looked back.  I love the Sony Digital Cameras.  I own three of them.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Camera!
Reviews.Author: Jeanne L. Stanley
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!  Came in the mail from Amazon, went by the local Sony dealer for a free one hour lesson and took the camera to the Grand Canyon the next day.  Unbelievable photos and so easy to use.  The panorama shot comes out beautifully and the video is very tight.  There is no lag time from when you push to take the photo and get the shot, something that has bothered me w/ other digital cameras.  I can't recommend this camera enough.  Very versatile, amazing zoom, light weight, for what you get and amazing photos.

Reviews.Title: perfect for busy mom
Reviews.Author: busysoftballmom
Reviews.Content: i have used this for taking photos as my daughter's fastpitch softball games. I have been able to take photos through the backstop without having all of the lines from the fencing. We have used the burst of photos to look at her batting swing. You can sit in the stands and get photos of the kids in the outfield that show their expressions clearly. I recomend this camera for those who want more than just a point and shoot and want to use the many setting available.

Reviews.Title: Super Sony Cybershot DSC HX1
Reviews.Author: Christine
Reviews.Content: I don't often write reviews, but I have to say that I am very happy with this camera! I had a Sony Cybershot, which is about 6 years old that took great pictures. I am just an average user and travel alot. I read alot of reviews about the camera and features, decided I wanted to get this camera. I haven't taken a ton of pictures, but have tried some of the features. The panoramic shot is awesome and I used it for a large room, can't wait to try it with landscape! Also, when it takes 10 pictures within seconds, that will be a neat feature as well. I made some little videos and very nice! I use the highest pixel setting and my friends thought it was tooo good on showing their wrinkles, LOL!! All in all, I am very happy and think this is a great product. I also found it was $30 cheaper on Amazon then Best Buy! Just be careful that you get a authentic memory card.

Reviews.Title: Great zoom!
Reviews.Author: K. Flamand
Reviews.Content: Just got this camera a few days ago and I love it. It is nice and light to carry around. Takes great photos, the zoom on it is so good and the speed at which it takes the pictures is great. I took some pictures of a humming bird last night and you can actually see the wings and they are not blurred at all. I will be taking this camera on our driving trip from MA to VA to GA and when I get back I will have more to review, but so far I'm in Love!

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Marla D. Nourse
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera!  Takes beautiful, clear pictures!  The adjustable screen on the back is great.  Used it at a get together and was able to get a good group shot from above and still see what I was doing!  My mom is even convinced that this needs to be her next camera as well!

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Marcelo Flores "Marcelo Zimmer"
Reviews.Content: For those adventurous amateur photographer, this camera will fit all your needs! So much fun with sweep panorama functionality! Nice pictures in low light conditions due to its technology which increases the light exposure by taking six pictures and integrating them. Of course, best results (less grain in pictures) might be achieved by increasing the exposure time at low ISO, but it may result in poor pictures of (not necessarily fast) moving subjects.

Reviews.Title: WISH I would have kept it
Reviews.Author: SERENDIPITY "ECLECTIC SOUL"
Reviews.Content: Well, you know what they say. Hind sight is 20/20. Lesson learned. This camera is wonderful and I am an idiot. I have now used the Nikon P100 (returned 2 due to lockup and then some more serious issues), this one, the Fuji HS10 and now I own the Panasonic FZ35. The sony has the BEST picture quality simply set to auto. The next would be the Nikon and Pany tied for 2cd with the Pany taking much better quality photos, and the 3rd would be the HS10 which in my HUMBLE opinion STANK in auto.  I returned the Sony to Wolf camera basically because I wanted to try the new HS10 ,which hadn't been released yet, and the fact that I owned so many nice FAST SDHC class 6 and 10 memory cards. And then I end up returning the Fuji. After the Sony I realized how bad the pics taken with the Fuji really were. But it was too late. So I just got the Panasonic. I do like it, but I am still learning the camera. I only recieved it yesterday.  The Sony takes beautiful macro shots with SUCH ease, not so for me with the other cameras. It took lovely night shots, good indoor shots and all in an auto settings mode. I wish I could say I played with other settings but I really didn't. The in camera Panning mode works really well, again, MUCH better picture than with the HS10 in the same mode.  Colors were lovely and pics were SHARP. I loved that. I would get some over processing, but I now realize all I had to do was go in and change the settings, tweek it a little. Live and learn.  So I simply want to recommend this camera. I have compared it to many others, but no Canons. so I'm of no help there. I feel almost anyone can take great pictures right out of the box with this baby.  I'm still kicking myself.

Reviews.Title: Love my camera
Reviews.Author: SurvivorD
Reviews.Content: I am enjoying the ease of use of this camera.  I love hikes and taking the panoramic shots and they are absolutely beautiful images...I've posted them on my Facebook and people comment that I could make my own calendars and posters.  The video is very good and easy to use.  I am not expert in photography but everything is easy to find that I feel more comfortable to try out the other options.  I've wanted a camera with a great zoom and this one sure has it.  I've been able to get fantastic shots - the camera fits right in the hand so it is very easy to hold.  It is a bigger camera - not anything that can slip in a pocket - but if you want fantastic zoom and quality pictures you have to sacrifice the camera size.  I hike with it and it is light and has not been in inconvenience yet especially when I see the quality shots I get.  Best I have had yet.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Ty
Reviews.Content: I really have enjoyed learning as many features on this camera as I can, though there is a lot to learn. I was anxious for this camera to be released and compared it very closely with the canon sx1.  They were very close on all counts, but the Sony simply had more features that matter a lot to me. The high speed shooting was important and at 10 frames per second there is no competition outside of high end slr's, and I do not like packing lenses.  Speaking of the lense, it is better than I thought it would be. Reviews.Title: Sony HX-1.Everything it is advertised to be.
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Williams
Reviews.Content: Excellant point and shoot.As good as some DSLR cameras.The HD movie mode and Sweep/panning mode work very well.An awesome little point and shoot.The 20x zoom is amazing.Get an extra battery and an 8 GB card.You'll need it for video.

Reviews.Title: Awesome

Reviews.Content: This is a great camera!! The quality of shots is amazing and the feature to have panoramic shots is awesome. I also use it for video and the video is amazing.... great product overall....

Reviews.Title: Quality Camera - Ton of features & Real HD Video
Reviews.Author: O'Farrell
Reviews.Content: I bought the DSC-HX1 two weeks ago from Sony Style, good deal if  you sign up for their visa.  Previously had an Olympus 840, which is a great camera and I will use when I need a pocket camera, however there is no going back once you start using the features of the Sony DSC-HX1.  It has a solid feel, not very light, and you need to take advantage of the neck strap.  Low light photographs are unbelievably good, no comparison to any other digital I have used.  The panorama feature is very cool, but wait until you take a video and watch it on your 1080i/p LCD TV.  I have a Sony 46" and I was knocked out by the quality of the picture and the color.  The sound is a little weak, but all things considered even the sound was acceptable.  The Sony DSC-HX1 features and Sony quality (made in Japan) makes the few extra bucks for this camera worthwhile.  I was leaning towards the Olympus SP-590UZ, which has a sweet long 26X zoom, but reviews were not the best for low light and no HD video.  If you have the extra $100, I don't think you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Excelent performance

Reviews.Content: Just got it today.  Pictures look pretty good in all modes.Excitedly, I took my first 720p video.  The video quality was very good. Admittedly, it was almost dusk and there was no noise to record, as I was in a very quiet front yard. But still. Zoom humm in my videos.I'll continue to test this camera, but my guess is this noise is distracting enough in the video to make me send the darn thing back.Why can't anyone make a camera that doesn't have some problem???So far, I've sent the Lumix FZ28 back (mono sound is lacking). Reviews.Content: This SONY camera is so nice. Getting a little aged now with technology always improving but the shots are still just great. Reviews.Title: VERY FAST AND SHARP CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: Stephen
Reviews.Content: Im a former owner of powershots.  This is a lot faster than any powershot I've used.  It focuses fast, and very well, and has a great burst mode. Its also sharp. The lens is one of Sony's best line of lenses.  I've taken many photos with this camera. I found the best setting to be the program mode with saturation up one, contrast normal, shadow detail off, and the ev down to -0.3.  I was impressed.  There are some who have mentioned noise as an issue.  I haven't noted a problem in my pictures, and I've made some big prints.  But I'm also an outdoors person. I shoot a lot of pictures outside and am only using the 125-200 ISO. On those two settings I've been hard pressed to find a lot of noise.  When I'm inside, however I have noticed noise on the 400 ISO setting. You will find this on a lot of point and shoots though.  Its not bad per say, but I wouldn't want to print a poster larger than 8x10 on 400 ISO. So inside I use the flash if it requires it.  The flash indoors is bright. I was in my kitchen and it lite up the living room quite well).  You can turn down the intensity if desired, but many wont.If there was one reason I would mark this camera down by a half a star, its the size. Its big. If your looking for something that has a decent zoom and can fit in your pocket or coat, its worth taking a look at Sony's h20. Its a 10x zoom camera with excellent reviews, and fantastic photo quality.  There is a basic optical principle that the greater the focal length, the less sharp the image becomes. Therefore, one might assume that the images might be better on the h20.  This however is not the case. While I wouldn't say the HX1 is necessarily sharper (they are both sharp), the lens on this HX1 issuperb. Because of this alone, i think this camera beats many of the megazoom cameras on the market today.  (You still get sharp images even zoomed in).Bottom line: Ive owned a Canon Powershot sd1000, 790is, sx10, sx20, and a lumix zs5. This camera is unlike any one I've used thus far. Sharp images, incredible zoom, excellent burst mode (ten shots in 10 seconds is a treasure for sports or nature goers), incredible video quality (Full HD is a huge plus and online videos show this quite well). I have absolutely no grumbles with noise at ISO 200 and below.  A lot of point and shoots let you get up to 400, before really noticing noise which can affect your print, but that's not the case with this one. This one Id say 200. 400 on this camera isn't bad. I would not hesitate to print 5x7s on 400 IS0, but if I were aiming for a large print, I would want 200 or lower. Of course, Im one to say this about any point and shoot that's not a SLR. Point and shoots simply have smaller sensor. If you want a camera which can take pictures well without using flash, you would do much better with a digital SLR.  But those are expensive. In terms of what you get in a point and shoot, this camera is quite impressive. I've been in plenty of woods with this camera in lower light and the twilight mode has really helped out a lot (it takes six burst shorts and processes those shots without a flash to give you one sharp image. So there are some ways to get around using ISO. I think sony purposely put that in knowing that noise above ISO was an issue. They took advantage of the CMOS sensor in this camera to use it for something that, while not helping much in terms of the noise on the higher ISOs, would help give one a good still shot in lower lighting with the twilight mode.In light of this, and the many other reasons listed, I would recommend this camera.  Its sharp, very very fast, has vibrant vivid colors on the settings Ive been using in program mode, and has a fantastic zoom.  Ive done multiple prints and have been very impressed by what Ive seen, both on the monitor and on prints.

Reviews.Title: CONFUSED
Reviews.Author: V.Q.M
Reviews.Content: I had to return this camera for a couple of reasons one of them being photo quality. Please read all the reviews on this camera. 5 star on down to make your mind up. I bought this camera because of the overwhelming majority of 4-5 star reviews. What I came up with is a mixed review from 5-1 stars. Some of everyone's complaints are filter through the all the reviews. I ignored them because what I often think is everyone has an option. Just starting at E-Z mode and what I like to call the green camera mode (on the dial for automatic) should of been the last resort when you just want to take a quick picture without using all the other options of manual, priority shutter, aperture setting, etc. etc. I have been taking pictures for a very long time and all around the world and love the idea of taking a quick great picture when I need to. This camera I thought would fit my needs as a quick shot of a photo by using the automatic settings or when I have time to select another setting for something creative. It has a wonderful zoom and ok micro. In the end I found myself only taking moon photos or just close ups. I ended up hating this camera because as one reviewer stated it cannot meet basic point and shoot features. True. I think it takes ok pictures under ideal conditions but if the weather is hazing or dark settings (inside house) without going through all the modes to get to the perfect picture then it pretty much noisy as they say meaning what I like to call the Fog. Never knew what Noise in digital photos meant until I own this camera. I own Sony cameras and Fuji cameras and this one I can't put my finger on it but I just plain do not like the camera. But you decide. I am not sure if I got a lemon but the one I used was a lemon.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera with amazing pictures!
Reviews.Author: Honest Abe
Reviews.Content: 5/1/2012: What we've come to realize about the camera is that the speed of the shutter is really slow. It takes a solid 5 seconds to take a picture...much too long with a baby. We miss nearly evert shot we would want because the camera doesn't click on time (or at least on time for what we need). The camera is lightweight and easy to carry, but really doesn't do what we need it to do with a baby. The pictures come out very nice, but again, because of the speed of the click they just don't get the picture you are necessarilly shooting. I see now why everyone told us to get the high speed camera (SLR)...with a baby it's a essential. If you aren't looking for a quick picture taking camera than this camera is great. If you need something that shoots pictures quickly this is not the camera you need.7/15/2011: We purchased this camera about a week after our son was born. It has everything that we would need, but it's not as high end as the $1000 cameras. We aren't picture savy people, but we do take a lot of pictures and this camera fits all of our needs. It's light weight, compact, and easy to use. The only cons I see so far are (1) the lens cap doesn't have a string so if you open the lens without taking the cap off it flies off the camera (annoying) and (2) the driver disc isn't compatible with Windows 7 (plug the camera into the computer and it will detect the camera on it's own. don't go to the site and locate the driver, it doesn't work right.)Definitely a good purchase for the price that this site is selling it for at this time.

So, if you want to figure out any of the special features, you may have to search online.

Reviews.Content: I got this camera because I am not a professional photographer and did not need a DSLR camera. I am extremely pleased with this camera because of the clarity of the photos. The battery is great, and the camera is easy to use once you play around with it for a little while. One of my favorite features is the smile feature, because it will take the picture right when it senses a smile from the subject. It takes a few seconds to record the pictures once you take them, but it is very neat and you can choose the speed at which you want your pictures to be taken. Reviews.Title: Sony Cybershot

Reviews.Title: Good camera but misleading zoom number
Reviews.Author: zenson1
Reviews.Content: I liked all of the features of the camera.  It's pretty easy to use if you've read the manual.  I recommend getting the complete manual.  Unfortunately if you're, like me, not happy with having to read it on your computer, you have to order a bound version from Sony, for about $11.00.  As a more-or-less amature photographer I expected the advertised 20X zoom to be similar to a 20X binocular.  Not even close.  The image, at the full zoom of the lens, is 20X the image size in the wide angle mode which is considerably smaller than that viewed with the naked eye.  My guess is that the actual zoom, from what the naked eye sees, is closer to 10 or 12X.Having said that, it's still a fine camera.  The image stabilization works very well and it shoot great macro shots.  The panorama feature is fun to use and likewise produces a fine image.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, great zoom, disappointing large prints
Reviews.Author: NBecker
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for about a year and overall I have been pretty happy with it, that is until I took it on a trip to Europe.  On the up-side, the zoom is amazing and sharp.  It's also fairly easy to tote around and produces nice 4x6, 8x8 and even 8x10 prints.  However, I am really disappointed in the quality of 11x14 or 16x20 prints.  I have a Nikon D40 and a Samsung TL34 HD, and each of them produce significantly better large prints than the DSCHX1.  As I mentioned, I took this camera with me to Europe, and was very excited to print some pictures that I thought were going to be stunning based off of the image on the LCD screen.  When I got them printed I thought the place I had them printed at had done something wrong, so I had them re-printed.  Same results.  Turns out it's the camera that is the cause of this, not the printer.  After doing some research, I see that there are multiple reviews noting that this camera does not produce quality large prints.If you want a pretty good overall camera for general use this is a good option.  I just wish I had been aware of the limitations with regard to quality of larger prints.  Also, the battery life is just average.

Reviews.Title: Surprising Sony
Reviews.Author: Elainer7

Reviews.Title: great purchase

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!!
Reviews.Author: Tiffany Oliveras
Reviews.Content: After several agnozing days of comparing cameras I finally decided on this one.  I have had Sony cameras in the past and I was happy with their performance so I figured I would go with Sony again.  I wanted to replace my current camera that was similar to this one, but a different brand (can't remember what brand it was...I think Nikon).  I was unhappy with my current camera regarding indoor photos.  They always ending up grainy and if I used the flash, they were always too bright.  This is the main reason I chose this camera becasue of the 'noise reduction' feature it has regarding indoor photos.Once I got the camera and started using it (it has been 11 months since I bought this camera), I was very impressed with the photo quality...even though it was less mega pixels than the camera I got rid of.  I was still slightly underwhelmed by the quality of the indoor pictures, but they were still better than the last camera so I decided to keep this camera.  My only other quip with this camera is that sometimes when you are trying to focus on something up close, it does not focus on what I want to take a picture of..more so it focuses past it.  But from what I have learned, this is just the quirks of auto-focus cameras.  There may be a manual setting on the camera to help this, but I haven't explored the issue yet.It has been almost a year since I bought this camera and I am still finding neat features on it.  Just the other day I found the feature for which I bought the camera for...the noise reduction setting.  I don't know how I missed it before.  Anyway, it basically takes several pictures over just a couple of seconds and combines all of them together to reduce the 'noise'.  All I can say is WOW!!  The pictures are so great!!  I have bought a photgraphy book to hopefully help me use the more advance settings on this camera.  I absolutely recommend this camera!!

Reviews.Title: You may need to know about crooked photos
Reviews.Author: Serg "Serg"
Reviews.Content: I use this camera over a year now. If to compare to SonyH7 the HX1 has better zoom, HD video (I burned couple DVD's with great blu ray quality - AVCHD). However if to compare with H7, the HX1 does not have the same clear pictures. The image of HX1 has more pixelization (I'd say like a gray and white fibers chaotically placed on persons' skin) when you zoom in image on your PC. I compared it with H7 and Sony H7 images does not have this defects. It's pretty frustrating. The good thing I liked about HX1 is that it takes 6 shots and combines them in one - Hand held Twilight mode. I liked it till I found out about some other defects. The recorded sound sounds like in it an empty jar. It's pretty thin, there are no bass tones. And I couldn't find the way to change audio settings. There is no plug for external microphone. There is another defect. The pictures are crooked for objects what are located at the distance 1.5 - 2 meters from the camera if object close to the edge of frame. So, if you take a picture of group people, all heads of persons what were close to the edge of frame were shifted from upper corner to the down center). Funny thing that it happens right after picture is taken. So, in live view you see no deformations, then press the button to take a picture - here they are! I had to use Photoshop all the time to fix it. Same by the way for Sony H55.By the way 16:9 - 6Mp -max, 4:3 - 9.1 Mp. So do not be misled. In low light recording mode camera is Ok but not great. Auto focus is not fast in a low light in picture mode and bad in recording mode in the dark. Manual focus will be pain if you filming a show. If you take a picture in low light or dark I'd recommend you to take off red eye reduction, face detection and set flash on single mode to have a time to catch the moment you need.

Reviews.Title: Great features, but ultimately a disappointment
Reviews.Author: Allan C. R
Reviews.Content: I was so excited when I bought this camera, everything seemed so great on paper, and even when I started using it, everything seemed great, yet when I downloaded the images to my computer...the horror! This camera is great in every way, except that it produces images that are the noisiest I've ever seen on any point and shoot camera! Even on the sunniest day, the images are full of noise (artifacts) that ruin the image. No, I'm not a so-called 'pixel-peeper', at any size, you'll see the disappointing image quality of this camera, and don't even bother trying to take a picture with less than ideal lighting, because the resulting images will be almost unusable. Another disappointment is the 'ultra-fast' burst mode, that does indeed take 10 images in 1 second as advertised, but then ties the camera for the next 20 seconds!Shame on you Sony, because all the features seem so great: the zoom, the HD video, the panoramic shots, the tilting screen; but the noise on the images is a deal breaker. I sold this camera and went a step down to a cheaper, smaller and less spec'd Canon, which takes amazingly good pictures, day or night, that are a real pleasure to look at. If you do want a prosumer, well-spec'd camera, I'm afraid you'll have to shell out the money for an exchangeable-lens DSLR camera, as these superzoom cameras (from any manufacturer) are not as great as they would make you believe, and you'll be disappointed with their image quality and ultimately with their performance.

Reviews.Title: Lots of features, but weak optics and some design glitches
Reviews.Author: Michel Deauville
Reviews.Content: The camera isn't a bad buy for the money -and it's on the high-side of prices for its class. It has lots of features. But anyone who thinks that an ultra zoom "works" is deluding themselves.  There's barrel distortion at wide angles and the images at 560mm telephoto equivalent are not very sharp. The lens also produces images with relatively weak contrast.The camera does not allow one to manually adjust contrast or color. That has to be done post processing, and the lack of RAW images limits serious image manipulation.There's some other annoying design attributes. To view images in the camera, the camera obviously has to be turned on, but that also extends the lens and pops the lens cap off. The program control knob is loose enough that the sometimes you'll find it set for something other than expected -that is, it'll switch with casual use from, say, Intelligent program mode to Easy or Vibration mode. Sure, that's user "error", but the engineering could be better.The main problem, though, is the optics for any advanced amateur. Sony can and should do better.
